meanings.definition: To surpass in bravery or courage.
meanings.sent1: She outbraves her fears by facing them head-on.
meanings.sent2: He outbraves all his competitors in the bravery contest.
meanings.sent3: The little mouse outbraves the big cat by standing its ground.
meanings.sent4: The hero outbraves the villain in a daring showdown.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter outbraves the flames to save the trapped family.

meanings.sent1: The young knight outbraves the dragon by standing up to it.
meanings.sent2: She outbraves the rules by always pushing the boundaries.
meanings.sent3: The student outbraves the teacher by questioning everything.
meanings.sent4: The rebel outbraves authority by speaking out against injustice.
meanings.sent5: The explorer outbraves the unknown to discover new lands.
